captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
[BABY CRYING]

Many of you are now passing
through physical, mental, and

emotional trials that could
cause you to cry out, "When I

have tried all my life to be
good, why has this happened to

me?" Now, I wish to encourage
those who are in the midst of

hard trials, who feel their
faith may be fading under the
onslaught of troubles.

There seems to me no better
answer to the question of why

trials come and what we are to
do than the words of the Lord

Himself, who passed through
trials for us more terrible
than we can imagine.

You may have seen the need for
that foundation, as I have, at

the bedside of someone ready to
give up the fight to endure
to the end.

If the foundation of faith is
not embedded in our hearts,

the power to endure
will crumble.
Sherman!
We're going to be late.
We've got to go right now.
Sherman, now!
Child, we've got to go!

Moroni, the son of Mormon
in the Book of
Mormon, told us how.

He teaches the simple and sweet
truth that acting on

even a twig of faith allows
God to grow it.

That particle of faith most
precious, and which you should

protect and use to whatever
extent you can, is faith in
the Lord Jesus Christ.

You and I have faith that the
way to rise through and above

trials is to believe that there
is a "balm in Gilead"

and that the Lord has promised,
"I will not ...

forsake thee." Curing does not
come automatically through the

passage of time, but
it does take time.

Getting older does
not do it alone.

It is serving God and others
persistently with full heart

and soul that turns testimony
of truth into unbreakable
spiritual strength.

If we have faith in Jesus
Christ, the hardest as well as

the easiest of times in life
can be a blessing.

In all conditions, we can choose
the right with the
guidance of the Spirit.

We have the gospel of Jesus
Christ to shape and guide our
lives if we choose it.

We never need feel that we are
alone or unloved in the Lord's
service because we never are.
We can feel the love of God.

The Savior has promised angels
on our left and on our right
to bear us up.
And He always keeps His word.
His love is unfailing.

I so testify in the name
of Jesus Christ, amen.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

title: Mountains To Climb - Gaining Power To Overcome Challenges In Life

that is holding my hand along with Jesus. He is my provider, He guides me

knows way before what I have to say. I Love My God with every breath He 
gives me, He knows my everything about me. He is My air that I breath 
because He breaths His sweet Breath into my lungs every second were ever I 
am.

comments.text:
I'm grateful that this video was suggested to me. My dear Mom suddenly 
passed away like 10 days before we go to the Temple and seal as a family, 
That was the dream I had after my mission. We prayed much and worked hard 
for the Temple journey.(Where I live, we don't have a Temple) I was heart 
broken and feeling numb! Because my Mom is not just my Mom, she was my Best 
friend too, she was well prepared and was a wonderful example to me and 
Dad. We went to the Temple without my dear Mother, I had a feeling she'd be 
there in the Temple in spirit. In the Temple Dad and I felt the peace and 
we got sealed as a family. However few weeks later, I was tempted to 
question God why my mom had to leave the earth before we go to the Temple, 
and I was having the most depressing time when my mom passed away, because 
nothing was working right in my life, but my dear Mother always encouraged 
me, things will work fine after going to the Temple. However my faith got 
shaken a lot. I didn't question God anymore because I felt like He has 
forgotten me. I wan't so bothered to go to the Church on Sundays or read 
scriptures. My prayers became much shorter.I was very unforgiving and got 
mad easily and I was looking for peace and happiness in other ways than the 
Christs way, It was today I felt the Spirit after going to the Temple. *Thank 
you sooo much for this video!* I really want to be the person I used to be, 
this little video just helped me to take a baby step. :) Now I'm gonna 
clean and tidy up my room and going to listen some GC talks and read 
scriptures. I know my Heavenly Father and earthly Father and my dear Mom in 
the Spirit world going to be very happy about this. Thank you, Thank you 
soooo much for sharing this.G'day! :)﻿
comments.author: Deanna Radiant

comments.text:
I am sorry for your loss. May the Lord bless you always and help you 
through your difficult times.

comments.text:
The Lord gives the hardest trails to those who He sees as able to complete 
them. If you are given a trial, look at what you were doing before, and 
know that if you continue to keep the commandments of the Lord, He will 
help you overcome the trial he has placed in front of you, and you will 
come out of it better than you have ever been. The trial my last until the 
end of your days, but if you remain faithful, he will bring you unto His 
heavenly kingdom.﻿

comments.text:
We all have mountains to climb and the path to eternal life is straight. 
our world today makes it hard for family's and for especially young people 
. if we can teach children at a young age to be in the world but not of the 
world. many there be could have less sufferings in there lives as they grow 
older. for many do fall into the ways of the worlds and end up doing drugs 
and alcohol and destroying there lives and making there lives more 
complicated. Many you people today take there own lives for they have lost 
hope in there lives because of situations happing in there lives . for one 
to over come challenges in ones life all one needs do is to look to the 
lord and call upon him in might prayer and to strive to keeping his 
commandments and in following the example of Jesus Christ. Life is more 
then abusing your self or another or substance, its about Love caring about 
one another serving one another doing what God would have you do .God say 
tha tall the trials and tribulations we go thru can ether make us stronger 
or it can break us it is the way we deal with each situation that come our 
way, remember that. never hate always forgive know matter what happens to 
you in your life and you will come out being the stronger person that God 
wants you to be .  Love one another forgive one another and ye to shell be 
loved and forgiven by our heavenly father. For he loves us all and love 
those more that would have him be there God.﻿

comments.text:
I'm going through so much in my life right now....  I cant put my thoughts 
together nor think staight.  I am in so much pain that i have bottled up 
and this incredible sadness that just wants to explode out of me.  I have 
lost so many loved ones this past year and i am on the verge of losing my 
job and I have bills that need to be paid and i dont know how they will 
paid. I am about to finish college and i have no way of paying my classes 
once i lose my job and I have a 17 yr old disabled sister who needs caring 
for and i have barely any food in my fridge and no money to buy groceries 
and i feel completely alone and helpless and horrible becuase i cant help 
my mother or sister as much as i wish i could. i know that God is amazing 
and when i saw this video i just cried and cried and cried because i had 
forgotten that everything will be ok.  Come what may come.  Everything wil 
work out....  I need prayer if anyone could pray for me.  I would so very 
appreciate it because the only thing that is keeping me sane is GOD'S 
LOVE....﻿

comments.author: RobS

comments.text:
Beautifully put.
Mormons don't have their own bible, though.  We believe in the bible as far 
as it is translated correctly and  follow the teachings of the King James 
version.  We also have something called the Book of Mormon which is another 
testament of Jesus Christ.  Its similar to a bible as it is still scripture 
but it doesn't replace the bible in any way, just expands on it.  That is 
the only SCRIPTURAL difference between Mormons and others.  I bet there are 
some missionaries where you live that can explain it better than me if you 
are confused.
comments.author: doppelgangerist
